dat1
Class TreeTraverser

java.lang.Object
  dat1.TreeTraverser

public abstract class TreeTraverser
extends java.lang.Object

Traverses a BinaryTree in either pre-, in- or post-order fashion.

The TreeNodeVisitor object that is supplied to the relevant traversal method, is called upon to visit each TreeNode during the traversal. Any required functionality is implemented in this visitor.

The following example prints out all the nodes in the BinaryTree tree, in ascending order: 

   tree.traverse(TreeTraverser.inOrder(
     new TreeNodeVisitor() { // anonymous inner class implementation.
       public void visit(TreeNode node) {
         System.out.println(node.toString());
       }
     }
   ));

Author:
K. Atas

Method Detail

traverse

public <K extends java.lang.Comparable<K>,V> void traverse(TreeNode<K,V> root)
Traverses a BinaryTree node by node starting at the specified, root node.

Parameters:
root - the root TreeNode. null if the tree to traverse is empty.

preOrder

public static TreeTraverser preOrder(TreeNodeVisitor visitor)
Returns a TreeTraverser that performs a pre-order traversal of a BinaryTree.

Looks at the root node first, then the left subtree, then the right subtree.

Parameters:
visitor - called upon to visit each TreeNode during the traversal.
Returns:
a TreeTraverser object.

inOrder

public static TreeTraverser inOrder(TreeNodeVisitor visitor)
Returns a TreeTraverser that performs an in-order traversal of a BinaryTree.

Looks at the the left subtree first, then the root node, then the right subtree.

Parameters:
visitor - called upon to visit each TreeNode during the traversal.
Returns:
a TreeTraverser object.

postOrder

public static TreeTraverser postOrder(TreeNodeVisitor visitor)
Returns a TreeTraverser that performs a post-order traversal of a BinaryTree.

Looks at the the left subtree first, then the right subtree, then the root node.

Parameters:
visitor - called upon to visit each TreeNode during the traversal.
Returns:
a TreeTraverser object.
